snippet: The agreement announced early Monday allows only the start of detailed negotiations on a new assistance package for Greece.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras reaches agreement with European leaders for bailout package of up to 86 billion euros, or $96 billion, in addition to easier repayment terms on some existing debt; deal requires Greece to embrace austerity measures, including pension cuts and tax increases.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and LIZ ALDERMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by James Kanter and Andrew Higgins from Brussels, Anemona Hartocollis and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, Alison Smale from Berlin, Jack Ewing from Frankfurt and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The agreement announced early Monday allows only the start of detailed negotiations on a new assistance package for Greece.

headline.main: Premier of Greece, Alexis Tsipras, Accepts Creditors’ Austerity Deal
headline.print_headline: Premier of Greece Accepts Creditors’ Austerity Deal
